request.description:
### User Signup

This endpoint allows users to sign up for the to-do application.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string) - The username of the user.
    
- `email` (string) - The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (string) - The password for the user account.
    

#### Response

Upon successful signup, the server returns a status code of 201 and a JSON object with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "user": {
        "username": "",
        "email": "",
        "password": "",
        "isDeleted": true,
        "_id": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

The `message` field may contain additional information, and the `user` object provides details of the newly created user account.

### Get User Profile

This endpoint retrieves the user's profile information.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- `id` (string): The unique identifier for the user.
    
- `username` (string): The username of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (string): The password of the user.
    
- `isDeleted` (boolean): Indicates if the user has been deleted.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the user profile was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The date and time when the user profile was last updated.
    
- `__v` (integer): Version key.
    
- `token` (string): The authentication token associated with the user.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "_id": "",
    "username": "",
    "email": "",
    "password": "",
    "isDeleted": true,
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "__v": 0,
    "token": ""
}

 ```

### Update User Profile

This endpoint is used to update the user's profile information.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string, required): The new username for the user.
    

#### Response

The response is in JSON format and has the following schema:

``` json
{
    "message": "string",
    "user": {
        "_id": "string",
        "username": "string",
        "email": "string",
        "password": "string",
        "isDeleted": true,
        "createdAt": "string",
        "updatedAt": "string",
        "__v": 0,
        "token": "string"
    }
}

 ```

- `message` (string): A message regarding the update operation.
    
- `user` (object): An object containing the updated user information.
    
    - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - `username` (string): The username of the user.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - `password` (string): The password of the user.
        
    - `isDeleted` (boolean): Indicates if the user is deleted.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the user was created.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the user was last updated.
        
    - `__v` (number): Version key.
        
    - `token` (string): The authentication token for the user.

# Delete User Profile

This endpoint is used to delete the user's profile from the to-do application backend.

## Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `https://to-do-application-backend-development.onrender.com/user/delete-profile`
    

## Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content Type: application/json
    

### Response Body

- `message`: A message indicating the result of the profile deletion.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

This endpoint is used to delete the user profile from the to-do application backend.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `https://to-do-application-backend-development.onrender.com/user/delete-profile`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "message": ""}
    

The request to this endpoint triggers the deletion of the user's profile. The expected input is the user's authentication credentials or any required parameters for user identification. Upon successful deletion, the response will contain a JSON object with a "message" key indicating the success of the operation.

request.description:
### Create a New To-Do Item

This endpoint allows you to create a new to-do item.

#### Request Body

- title (text, required): The title of the to-do item.
    
- description (text, required): The detailed description of the to-do item.
    
- dueDate (text, required): The due date for the to-do item in ISO Date format.
    
- priority (text, required): The priority level of the to-do item.
    
- category (text, required): The category of the to-do item.
    

#### Response

Upon successful creation, the response will have a status code of 201 and a JSON object containing the message and details of the created to-do item, including its title, description, due date, priority, status, category, user, and other metadata.

Example Response:

``` json
{
  "message": "",
  "todo": {
    "title": "",
    "description": "",
    "dueDate": "",
    "priority": "",
    "status": "",
    "category": "",
    "user": "",
    "isDeleted": true,
    "_id": "",
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "__v": 0
  }
}

 ```

response.name: To-Do - Create ToDo

body.raw:
{
  "title": "D Mart",
  "description": "pant , tshirt , soup, milk",
  "dueDate": "2024-11-24",// ISO 8601 format
  "priority": "medium",
  "category": "shopping"
}

response.body:
{
    "message": "To-Do created successfully",
    "todo": {
        "title": "D Mart",
        "description": "pant , tshirt , soup, milk",
        "dueDate": "2024-11-24T00:00:00.000Z",
        "priority": "medium",

        "_id": "673ec3c11251f465387a5e2e",
        "createdAt": "2024-11-21T05:23:13.049Z",
        "updatedAt": "2024-11-21T05:23:13.049Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

request.description:
# To-Do Application Backend Development API

This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve filtered to-do items based on status, priority, and due date.

### Request Parameters

- `status` (string, required): The status of the to-do items. Possible values: "pending", "completed".
    
- `priority` (string, required): The priority level of the to-do items. Possible values: "low", "medium", "high".
    
- `dueDate` (string, required): The due date of the to-do items in the format "YYYY-MM-DD".
    

### Response

The API returns a JSON object with the following structure:

- `total` (number): The total number of filtered to-do items.
    
- `todos` (array): An array of to-do items matching the filter criteria, each containing the following fields:
    
    - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the to-do item.
        
    - `title` (string): The title of the to-do item.
        
    - `description` (string): The description of the to-do item.
        
    - `dueDate` (string): The due date of the to-do item.
        
    - `priority` (string): The priority level of the to-do item.
        
    - `status` (string): The status of the to-do item.
        
    - `category` (string): The category of the to-do item.
        
    - `user` (string): The user associated with the to-do item.
        
    - `isDeleted` (boolean): Indicates whether the to-do item is deleted.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The creation timestamp of the to-do item.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The last update timestamp of the to-do item.
        
    - `__v` (number): Version key for optimistic concurrency control.
        

Example Response:

``` json
{
  "total": 0,
  "todos": [
    {
      "_id": "",
      "title": "",
      "description": "",
      "dueDate": "",
      "priority": "",
      "status": "",
      "category": "",
      "user": "",
      "isDeleted": true,
      "createdAt": "",
      "updatedAt": "",
      "__v": 0
    }
  ]
}

 ```

response.name: To-Do - Get ToDos with Fiterations

request.description:
# Update Todo

This endpoint allows the client to update a specific to-do item.

## Request

### HTTP Method

PUT

### URL

[https://to-do-application-backend-development.onrender.com/todo/update/673ddd61fb2a2a88b9e76888](https://to-do-application-backend-development.onrender.com/todo/update/673ddd61fb2a2a88b9e76888)

### Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    

### Request Body

- title (string): The title of the to-do item.
    
- description (string): The description of the to-do item.
    
- status (string): The status of the to-do item (e.g. completed, pending, in-progress).
    
- priority (string): The priority level of the to-do item (e.g. high, medium, low).
    
- category (string): The category of the to-do item.
    
- dueDate (string): The due date for the to-do item.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "title": "Buy groceries from store",
  "description": "Milk, bread, vegetables, fruit ...",
  "status": "completed",
  "priority": "medium",
  "category": "shopping",
  "dueDate": "2024-11-25"
}
## Response
### Status
200
### Headers
- Content-Type: application/json
### Response Body
```json
{
  "message": "",
  "todo": {
    "_id": "",
    "title": "",
    "description": "",
    "dueDate": "",
    "priority": "",
    "status": "",
    "category": "",
    "user": "",
    "isDeleted": true,
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "__v": 0
  }
}

 ```

response.name: ToDo - Update ToDo

 "description": "Milk, bread, vegetables, fruits, chocolate",
 "status":"completed",
"priority":"medium",
"category": "shopping",
"dueDate":"2024-11-25"
}

request.description:
### DELETE /todo/delete/{id}

This endpoint is used to delete a specific to-do item.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Path Parameters

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the to-do item to be deleted.
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

- `message` (string): A message indicating the result of the delete operation.

request.description:
### Get To-Do Reminders

This endpoint retrieves a list of to-do reminders expires within the next 3 days from the current date.  
  

**Request Body**  
This is a GET request and does not require a request body.

**Response**

- `total` (number): The total number of to-do reminders.
    
- `todos` (array): An array of to-do reminder objects, each containing the following properties:
    
    - `_id` (string): The unique identifier of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `title` (string): The title of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `description` (string): The description of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `dueDate` (string): The due date of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `priority` (string): The priority of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `status` (string): The status of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `category` (string): The category of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `user` (string): The user associated with the to-do reminder.
        
    - `isDeleted` (boolean): Indicates if the to-do reminder is deleted.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The creation date of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `updatedAt` (string): The last update date of the to-do reminder.
        
    - `__v` (number): Version key for optimistic concurrency control.
        

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "total": 0,
    "todos": [
        {
            "_id": "",
            "title": "",
            "description": "",
            "dueDate": "",
            "priority": "",
            "status": "",
            "category": "",
            "user": "",
            "isDeleted": true,
            "createdAt": "",
            "updatedAt": "",
            "__v": 0
        }
    ]
}

 ```

request.description:
### Get To-Do Items by Keyword

This endpoint retrieves to-do items based on the provided keyword.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `https://to-do-application-backend-development.onrender.com/todo/search/keyword`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - keyword (string, required): The keyword to search for in the to-do items."Keyword" is the key or default variable and value can be search value user want to insert.
        

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "total": 0,
    "todos": [
        {
            "_id": "",
            "title": "",
            "description": "",
            "dueDate": "",
            "priority": "",
            "status": "",
            "category": "",
            "user": "",
            "isDeleted": true,
            "createdAt": "",
            "updatedAt": "",
            "__v": 0
        }
    ]
}

 ```
